I’m going to start by saying we ended up having a good stay. The situation/price could have been better. You can hear people talking through the walls in adjoining apartments. Outside our bedroom window we heard loud talking in Spanish until a little after midnight and obviously noise that was coming from something being moved around on metal…At one point, I opened the curtain and was very surprised to see two guys sitting in the back of a pickup less than 2 feet from bedroom window and one of them looking directly at me. This was about a half hour before they finally went inside. It didn’t seem to bother them at all that they were obviously keeping us up. This isn’t Noah’s fault, but it was a bit creepy. The other thing is that the total cost was I think slightly over $150, which would have given me a very nice hotel chain type room that’s up to date instead of a dated house that I could hear everyone around me through the walls. By the time you get service fees, cleaning fees, Air bnb fees, etc, the price exceeds the value at $150+
The pros? Noah is very responsive and great at communicating to let you know where the place is and how to get in, where to park. The place was clean, and did not smell. You had everything you need and a full size fridge and bathroom supplies. Noah doesn’t control how much Air bnb takes and he has to make a living as well. Location was good and parking was convenient.

There were also a few snacks out as a little welcome gift -- individual packets of oreos, popcorn, cheese its, etc.
Overall, a great place to stay for a great price. Ashley and the host were quick to respond and address any comments/questions/concerns. Checking in and out was a breeze. I would recommend staying here and would surely stay again the next time I find myself in Fargo!
